author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector M. Karunakaran (second from left) inspecting the counting centre at Sri Parasakthi College for Women in Courtallam in Tirunelveli district on Saturday.

Accompanied by Superintendent of Police V. Vikraman, Collector M. Karunakaran inspected the Assembly poll votes counting centre to be set up at Parasakthi College for Women at Courtallam on Saturday.

As the votes to be polled in Palayamkottai, Tirunelveli, Alangulam, Nanguneri and Radhapuram Assembly segments would be counted in separate centres to be created at GCE here, Dr. Karunakaran and Mr. Vikraman visited the venue on Saturday and discussed the three-tier security arrangements to be made on the premises.

They also finalised the minor modifications to be done in the counting halls and other rooms with temporary partitions based on requirements.

Votes to be polled at Tenkasi, Kadayanallur, Vasudevanallur (Reserve), Sankarankovil (Reserve) and Ambasamudram constituencies would be counted at Sri Parasakthi College for Women at Courtallam.
title: Counting centre inspected
